intro: Robertiella robertianum, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
